result.execSummary:
The defendant Britney M Gavitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

AODA and follow up;

DNA sample

Case Called: 9:08 am
INCLUDES 22CF496 & 20CF1132.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Kat Yanke in person. 
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
20CF1132:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.

22CF496:
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine-Repeater-PTAC)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Possession of THC-Repeater-PTAC)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 5 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 6 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
 
PLEA: 
20CF1132:
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.

22CF496:
Ct. 7 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater-PTAC)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
20CF1132:
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, AODA and Follow up, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge.

22CF496:
Ct. 7 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater-PTAC)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, AODA and Follow up, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 3 Days Credit.

Adjourned: 9:22 am
